content.description: The supply (S) and demand (D) for a good are shown in the diagram above.
content.question: At a price of <math alttext="P 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> in the diagram above, which of the following is true?

choices.label: The existing surplus in the market will cause upward pressure on prices until equilibrium is reached at 75 units.
The existing surplus in the market will cause downward pressure on prices until equilibrium is reached at 60 units.
The existing shortage in the market will cause upward pressure on prices until equilibrium is reached at 30 units.
The existing shortage in the market will cause upward pressure on prices until equilibrium is reached at 60 units.
The existing shortage in the market will cause downward pressure on prices until equilibrium is reached at 45 units.

content.answer: The existing shortage in the market will cause upward pressure on prices until equilibrium is reached at 60 units.

topic.text: 1.6: Market Equilibrium, Disequilibrium, and Changes in Equilibrium

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Using economic concepts, principles, or models, explain how a specific economic outcome occurs, or what action should be taken in order to achieve a specific economic outcome.
